results.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
results.creator_credit: Leo McCarey, Rainbow Educational Video and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A battle of wits emerges between Father O’Malley and Sister Benedict when their ideas clash in how the children should be taught at St. Mary’s School. However, Sister Benedict takes a tip from his unusual methods and buys a boxing book and a baseball bat, then finds herself in the business of making men out of boys. It’s not Father O’Malley’s only battle. The school is badly in need of repairs and a cynical millionaire has started proceedings to condemn the school building. Starring Ingrid Bergman and Bing Crosby.

results.title: The Beach = La Plage
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Gervais, Francine Desbiens and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film touches upon the theme of solitude and is a fantasy that leaves the viewer free to speculate. A woman drowns, unnoticed by three men sitting with their backs to the sea. Two of them are throwing dice; the third is drinking a glass of water.

results.title: The Belle of New York
results.creator_credit: Charles Walters, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A musical set in New York in the 1890s in which a playboy seeks redemption in the arms of a mission girl. This is the pretext for transforming Astaire’s past decadence into present zaniness and Vera-Ellen’s primness into sauciness. Despite the suggestion of fairytale fantasy - lovers truly in love can literally walk on air - this is at core a folk musical with an idealised New York as a slightly larger version of hometown, a community to be celebrated. Several lively dance numbers are designed to evoke the paintings of Currier and Ives. This was Astaire’s personal favourite of his musicals. Cast also includes Marjorie Main, Keenan Wynn, Alice Pearce, Clinton Sundberg, Gale Robbins. Music by Harry Warren, lyrics by Johnny Mercer.

results.title: The Bedford incident
results.creator_credit: James B. Harris, Richard Widmark, Columbia and Bedford Productions
results.brief_description: During a routine peacetime patrol in the Greenland Straits, the USS Bedford’s sonar picks up an unidentified submarine. The destroyer’s commander, Captain Finlander, (Richard Widmark), relentlessly pursues the lurking sub as a training exercise for his crew, keeping his men at battle stations for hours. Top-flight photo-journalist, Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) and NATO observer Schrepke (Eric Portman), try to warn him about this dangerous game, however Finlander is determined to win at all costs. A gripping “Cold War” classic.

results.title: The Beguiled
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Malpaso Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A wounded Union soldier is discovered by a young student from a crumbling Louisiana girls’ school during the Civil War. The academy takes their prize in and cares for him, and the cunning, mysterious soldier uses the all-female situation to coolly play off each of his captors to his own advantage. This carefully manuoevred sexual powderkeg finally explodes and the film spirals downwards into a pit of released repression and psychological horror. Stars Clint Eastwood and Geraldine Page. Based on the novel by Thomas Cullinan.

results.title: The Beach
results.creator_credit: Danny Boyle, Andrew Macdonald and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on Alex Garland’s best selling novel, this take on the Lord of the flies tale, reunites the production team (Danny Boyle, Andrew Macdonald, John Hodge) behind Shallow Grave and Trainspotting. Leonardo DiCaprio stars as Richard, a jaded American backpacker traveling around Thailand, in search of adventure. Bored with the familiar tourist routes the island has to offer, he happens upon Daffy (Robert Carlyle), a shady character who shows Richard a map to an island paradise that is hidden from the average tourist. Richard then takes the map and sets out along with a French couple (Virginie Ledoyen and Guillaume Canet) he meets in Bangkok in search of the mythical island. Once there however they discover that this secret utopia comes at a very dangerous price. Cast includes Tilda Swinton, Peter Gevisser, Lars Arentz-Hansen, Staffan Kihlbom. Special collectors edition includes: behind the scenes footage, alternate opening/ending, music video-All Saints “Pure Shore”, original theatrical trailer.

results.title: The Beaver
results.creator_credit: William H. Carr, John A. Haeseler and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Highlights activities of the beaver in its natural environment. Illustrates ways in which the beaver’s teeth, feet, and tail help him in swimming, eating, felling trees, and repairing a broken dam. Reveals the unique construction of a beaver house, and stresses the importance of the animal as an agent of conservation and as a valuable fur bearer.

results.title: The Bayeux Tapestry
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Vivet, Roger Leenhardt and Films du Compas
results.brief_description: Follows closely the narrative sequences of the Bayeux Tapestry which is, more accurately, an embroidery - a piece of coarse linen 230 feet long and 20 inches wide. The story of Harold’s journey to the continent in 1064, his experiences in Europe, the battle of 1066 and finally his death. Its origin is uncertain but the consensus of expert opinion is that it is contemporary and was probably executed in England at the order of Bishop Odo of Bayeux, William the conquerors’ half-brother, as an ornament for his then new cathedral.

results.title: The Beat of distant hearts
results.brief_description: Through various Saharawi artists, poets and singers, this documentary tells the tragic story of the Saharawi nomads who were forced into exile from their homeland, the former Spanish colony of Western Sahara in North-West Africa, by the Moroccan invasion in 1975. For 15 years an armed struggle raged between the occupying Moroccans and the Polisario Front, the national liberation movement of the Saharawis, until 1991 when a ceasefire took place, monitored by the United Nations. Over 170,000 refugee Saharawis live in camps established in the harsh barren desert of Southwestern Algeria. In 1992 the United Nations attempted to sponsor a referendum for the Saharawis to vote for their future in Western Sahara - asking whether the Saharawis wished to remain a part of Morocco or rule themselves. However obstacles and disputes prevented the referendum and subsequent attempts have similarly been thwarted. Eventually it was decided to delay the vote until July 2000. The artists in this story tell of their own personal experiences, their day-to-day life and the effect the conflict has had on their families, and how the ongoing struggle for independence has kept alive their culture and influenced their works. In turn, it has been through their works that they have been able to educate, express and motivate their people to maintain the fight for independence. Director Danielle Smith lived as a member of a large extended family in the Saharawi refugee camps in southwest Algeria and taught English at the Women’s Vocational Centre. Through this experience she gained a close understanding of the culture and society. NB: The color in the film appears faded and washed out and the quality of the lighting to be overexposed. However this tonal condition lends itself to giving the film an air of surrealism.
